intro: Campanula rapunculus var. spiciformis, commonly known as the spiciform bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Native to Europe, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
